ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes. AI is an important course and a famous topic in Computer Science. Anyone who has time and choice should take it.
Take it. But not with 70 students :D
I'd recommend it to students that are looking for a reasonably broad introduction to AI but don't have a lot of specific interest in a given subfield.
If you are seeking a very broad, introductory course on AI, yes.

It is an introduction course, you will not learn anything really technical but you will get an idea about what can be done in AI. Do not expect to come out of this course with any technical skill, this is almost cultural.This is not what I expected from a graduate course so I would not recommend it. For the reasons, see my answer to the first question.
I recommend this course. It helps get a broad view of AI.
Take this class for sure, even though its a hard class.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Yes. AI is a great topic, which could be helpful for any fields.
I learned a lot about AI techniques and the history of the field. I'm not sure how useful what I've learned will be in the future.
The course helped with topics I am interested with for my research.

Now I have an idea of what AI is about. Since I plan to become a researcher in computer science it was interesting to see what is hidden under the AI "hat".No fundamental neither enlightening facts were revealed to me during this course.
